trans-unit.source: The FailoverTestScenario is a test which runs a series of faults against a specific parition defined by the PartitionSelector in the FailoverTestScenarioParameters.
trans-unit.target: The FailoverTestScenario is a test which runs a series of faults against a specific parition defined by the PartitionSelector in the FailoverTestScenarioParameters.

trans-unit.source: The faults induced put the partition through some specific failover scenarios to ensure those paths are tested and exercised.
trans-unit.target: The faults induced put the partition through some specific failover scenarios to ensure those paths are tested and exercised.

trans-unit.source: Running your workload against the service at the same time as the test being run will increase the chances of inducing and discovering bugs with the service.
trans-unit.target: Running your workload against the service at the same time as the test being run will increase the chances of inducing and discovering bugs with the service.

trans-unit.source: The faults induced for the Primary, Secondaries and stateless instances are RestartReplica(only persisted), RemoveReplica, ResartDeployedCodePackage, MovePrimary (only Stateful), MoveSecondary (Only Stateful), RestartPartition (no data loss).
trans-unit.target: The faults induced for the Primary, Secondaries and stateless instances are RestartReplica(only persisted), RemoveReplica, ResartDeployedCodePackage, MovePrimary (only Stateful), MoveSecondary (Only Stateful), RestartPartition (no data loss).
